I just couldn't figure out why this movie got only 5.4 in IMDb rating.Trust me, this is a great horror movie to enjoy. I think this is surprisingly underrated. The story line is good enough. Though there is some questionable moments, but, overall I just enjoyed it. At least this is far better than many other horror films like 'It Follows'.

The avarage rating and the metacritic score for this movie is an example of how much horror is still the most underestimated genre in cinema( and beyond). This movie is an averegly good horror, that rely a bit too much on cliches and ghost movements to build the mood, but that is enough well shot, well acted and well written to be enjoyable and fun. In ten years we won't look back at this movie as a game changer, but I will remember it like a fun movie. Isn't it enough to reach at least a 6.0 average or a 50 in metacritic score? I think yes, specially after i see on this website that horror masterpiece hardly reach 6.0 and that being part of marvel cinematic universe give a movie the right to at least a 7.0.
Do me a favor, before you give a vote to an horror movie stopfor a second, thuink to your previous votes and ask yourself if you are being fair to the movie or just misjudging a gente.To comment the movie i think is a nice add to the conjuring universe...if this is the lowest entry( as a lot of people say) is the signal of how much quality, despite the clear commercial intentions, this movies are bringing on screen. The movie look good and the plot, even if not really original, is a good mix of "influences" and is not boring or cringy. Some scenes are really creepy and some jump scares are really good( yes jumpscares are not necessary a sin), but the general atmosphere of the movie is not too much haunting so you will walk out of the cinema without paranoia and nigthmares( if you don't sleep with dools in the room).
Best horror movie I like it a lot must watch i love it
The best horror movie there is awesome I like it better love it

Review title: Inspired Horror in an Uninspired Package
Review_body: Annabelle had a lot to live up to after The Conjuring - a film that breathed new life into a thoroughly played out genre. Unfortunately, it did not do so, and has endured an inflated amount of bad press as a result. The key to The Conjuring's success was a combination of truly well-crafted scare sequences, together with an engaging narrative and cast of characters. Director John R. Leonetti recaptures the first of these two components very well in Annabelle, but unfortunately falters with the latter.Both movies follow a formula that involves long periods of potentially terrifying situations turning out to be completely mundane, before then following through with the terror when sufficient tension has been built up. Annabelle uses the same fantastically executed visual and audial techniques to attempt to build this tension, but an audience will only feel a sense of dread if they actually care what happens to the characters on screen.In a word, the characters in Annabelle are bland. As a result, the long periods in between jump scares tend to end up feeling similarly bland - which is never a thing you want 50% of your runtime to be described as.The blandness is far from unbearable, however, and encased within it are some incredibly well crafted scenes. The home invasion near the start of the film is scary as hell. The elevator sequence is unforgettable. The eponymous doll herself is perpetually creepy, and the moment we finally catch her in motion is perfectly harrowing. Speaking of dear old Annabelle, she is featured sparingly but just enough to retain her fear factor, and I cannot stress how good a choice it was to avoid turning her into a Chucky-esque creature that walks, talks and murders on-screen.Throughout all of these shiny and not so shiny moments, our peripheral vision is bombarded with endless potential hazards - teasing us with the anticipation of a scare at all times, with a successful pay-off pretty much every time it actually follows through. The film is undoubtedly scary. Many people will argue against this point, but these same people tend not to be phased by any Horror media and thus set unachievable standards for 'scariness' (which is entirely subjective regardless).Overall, the two sides of the Annabelle coin come together to make a somewhat average film, but a must-see experience if you are a horror enthusiast!

Review title: Guaranteed to make you jump and your skin crawl
Review_body: It seems like a while since I watched a horror movie with religious themes. The movie starts with a cult attack on a beautiful young couple and later gets the Catholic Church involved. Nothing gets the imagination going than the all powerful good vs evil. Add to this the creepy look of the doll and settings and you've got an entertaining horror.That being said, the movie is full of clichés and stereotypes. That's fine because the depth of their character is not the main attraction. The movie sucks you in slowly with the creepiness that by the end you're willing to just go along for the ride.

Upon watching this film for the first time I thought that this film was going to be a female version of Childs Play(1988).Although the storyline and plot is very much different I find that there are similarities to Childs Play such as defeating the doll in an apartment flat.Putting those aside, it is an entertaining film to sit and watch. There is always something just around the corner to make you sit up and take notice and that is important in a horror film of this type as I have come across other films in this genre that I felt didn't live up to their name and expectations. After a man gives a doll to his wife as a gift to add to her collection, the neighbours get killed by a "Manson" cult, the doll ends up becoming possessed by one of the members of the cult. Strange unexplainable things then begin to happen but when the couple moves the entities follow them to their new home. Some of the film appears to parody "Rosemary's baby(1968)" once the film settles into the flat. But that's my opinion. The last overall scene's were very good and well written, but the open ending was a bit disappointing.

One of the least interesting horror movies I've watched! I'm not even comparing this to "The Conjuring"!Weak story line, pathetic acting combined with inexperience of the filmmaker make this a complete time-waste !Where do you even find such actors ! It's a shame to call the actors ! The female lead is horrible when it comes to performance! She is just a good looking model ! Nothing more ! I'm surprised, how did she even land up with this role! Maybe through a godfather in industry !Such an important and impressive theme, and she makes a mockery of all of it! They have better actors and and a better story in porn movies !

This movie is just as scary as a Barbie movie and just as interesting as Teletubbies. If you're looking for a movie to fall asleep with, this is the perfect choice, but if you're looking for a scary movie choose anything else than this. The 60'ies setting doesn't interest me at all, the ugly doll is only begging the question "who in their right mind would ever want to own such ugly doll, let alone put in own display". The movie is also extremely predictable. Here I was watching the movie half asleep (maybe 30 minutes into the movie), pretty sure I actually did fall asleep a few times, when my wife asked me what I think will happen, unfortunately my predictions were correct

Review title: Jumps and Scares at itz best!!!
Review_body: I neva knew about the film when i first heard. But it was breathtaking.Not the James Wan kind of horror, but indeed a good one. This film has got a lot of jumps and scares which keeps you scared till the end. Not much story, but sound effects certainly did a good job with fine camera positions. This is not a conjuring kind of film. so, not to compare both. There are certain scenes which takes us to the edge of the seat. And thats what we expect...Don't we?? But why do Annabelle need a soul??? Thatz sound amusing. Isn't it?? As a whole, this film is worth watch twice in theatres. If Horror is your Genre, then this is the film!!!

I had been anxiously awaiting this movie for nearly three months. Being a James Wan junkie, I could barely sit on my hands until Annabelle hit theaters... I mean, come on! Demonic Doll tries to slaughter beautiful young family? Where could it go wrong? And yet, somehow it managed to go wrong in every possible way I hadn't thought, and even created a few more ways to go wrong along the way.If I could describe the movie -- It would be 'Indecisive demon terrorizes family for sacrifice only to turn out to be perfectly comfortable accepting just about anybody.' The movie's core 'meat and potatoes' nearly had to take a backseat to the unnecessarily extended amount of footage allotted to absolutely nothing. Literally. Nothing. Family washing dishes. Family changing baby. Family goes shopping. Husband and Wife talking about how much they love each other.Don't get me wrong, the most effective horror movies invite the audience into a sense of normality before striking hard and heavy -- But the scares in Annabelle could have happened regardless of those scenes, or at least with less than half of the ones that there were.You should leave a horror movie feeling the resonating chills still tickling your neck. Annabelle just left me frustrated and more focused on my leftover popcorn then what I had just watched.All that being said, there were some clever scenes that were pleasing cinematographically, and were really the only reasons I didn't rate it even lower. The chase up the staircase mid-movie, for instance, or the basement storage room/elevator scene, I had thought was 'Japanese horror movie' good.Ultimately, what scared me the most about the movie was that it had amazing potential, and wasted the vast majority of it.And that pi**es me off.

Review title: So boring I'm writing the review to keep me awake...
Review_body: Having been a huge skeptic of this genre it took a lot of nagging to get me to watch the Conjuring 1/2, to my surprise I found these to be highly interesting, good suspense, a few decent scares and some characters to actually care about!That of course let me to Annabelle which unfortunately is a return to form for the genre, relying on bad attempts at jump scares, a weak uninteresting back story for some very annoying characters you're hoping the demon/ghost will dispatch of quickly.Filled with dialog my 6 year old could spice up, acting the same 6 year old probably wouldn't buy and we have Annabelle. A cash grab spin off from the Conjuring series that completely departs from what made those films successful.Skip at all costs.

at first i thought Annabelle would not be that scary of a movie. haunted scary doll? completely over done. but boy was i wrong. this movie definitely made me lose sleep for nights. there were moments in this movie that definitely left me wide eyed. one part in particular was (spoiler alert) when the main character could not find her baby and when she went to look in the babies crib all she saw was Annabelle. then she proceeded to slam the doll multiple times on the crib and throw it across the room and then it made her believe it was actually her baby and not the doll. this movie definitely left me scared. i've seen a lot of scary movies in my life but this one was definitely one of the best.

Review title: Not as bad as I thought
Review_body: I think that due to the sheer exhilaration that the conjuring brought forward it was going to be hard to make a sequel/spin-off, but Annabelle was surprisingly okay. The action started pretty quickly which is always good to keep a horror going, the plot line was also very fluid and flowed nicely with the horror which made it feel more realistic as we get to see the characters. Annabelle Wallis plays very well as the distressed mother as she can easily show her emotions from terror to surprised she gives it her all. Ward Horton also portrays his character very well as I truly hate him for dismissing everything his wife says which I'm sure was very precalculated. I also think that the film becomes more of a thriller near the end as the victim is the baby, Leah. It truly makes my skin crawl to hear the screams of the baby and the scared shouts of the mother as a demon tries desperately to separate them. The best scene in the whole film has to be when Mia believes that she is attacking and hurting Annabelle but it is actually another doll but for that split second we are lead to believe that it was Leah she was throwing about. On the whole it wasn't as disappointing as I thought it would be.

Annabelle is a movie that does exactly what it is supposed, horrify you, but it's downfall is that it has a poor story line. The story revolves around a family that is expecting a child. John, the husband, gets a vintage doll, Annabelle, for his wife, Mia, as he believes it is the perfect gift for her. But strange things start to happen to them, for Annabelle is haunted. The movie's success is in how it creates suspense and fear. For instance, the scene that leads up to their house burning creates suspense in two ways. As Annabelle, turns on the stove to burn the house down, Mia is in her room sewing. The camera slowly zooms in on Mia's finger that she is using to sew, which alludes to her soon cutting her finger. To add on to the suspense, non-diagetic suspenseful music that slowly gets louder is used to create a build up to her cutting her finger on the sewing machine and the house burning. The movie's downfall though, is the fact that it mainly focuses on horror, not the story line. Mia leaving her baby unattended several times throughout the movie does not add up to the plot because she knew strange things were happening and eventually finds out Annabelle wants her daughters innocent soul. To conclude, Annabelle could be better if it was made to be a bit more realistic by simply changing some of the characters actions.

OK.This movie was so god damn hyped its ridiculous. Everyone was so hyped because its a "doll-killer" movie. They also stole a lot from other movies to make this one which is pathetic. The Annabelle doll exists in other movies just so people know. I wont spoil because its some scenes in this movie that shows it.Well if you want to watch a crappy movie about some doll that kills, then watch it i guess. There are way better "doll-killer" movies out there like Childs play and all those classics.This was hyped for nothing and i was extremely disappointing. I hope the people that made this movie watches this review and realize how bad it was. I'm sorry I've seen pretty much every Horror movie out there and this is just beyond bad.Don't waste your time. I'm serious.

We didn't really enjoyed this movie. We were like "Hell yeah, this is gonna be good as The Conjuring" BUT it wasn't... We expected more jumpscares, more creepy-eerie, more like SCARY at all. What we got: Few jumpscares and... that's all. So predictable movie, we didn't even got scared, maybe once or twice, just one of us was scared at all time. He liked it... but it was just him. It wasn't that good as we expected, so we do not recommend this movie, but if you want... Try it
No suspense, no interesting story, okay acting and not scary at all

Review title: Nowhere near to Conjuring in every way
Review_body: I am a big fan of horror movies. I went to this movie with high expectation expecting it will do justice as a prequel to one of my favorite horror movie "The Conjuring". But I was really disappointed after seeing this movie. It lacks that story line, effective narration and of course the horror element. Except for the couple of scenes there is nothing in the movie. First 30 minutes is really boring. I felt this film has borrowed scenes from famous horror (don't wanna mention names) and just added bit of its own story line to it. There is nothing in the movie which keeps you to glued to your seat or keep on your toes. For a horror movie I personally feel background score plays a crucial role which is lacking in this movie. Over all fun to watch provided if you expect least from the movie.Pros: Couple of scenes. lead actress performance (she is not great but of all she is good) Ghost animation (Which I feel similar to the one in Drag me to Hell)Cons: Not scary No interesting story line Expected narration Loud background score

Review title: AMAZINGLY creepy - maintains all the quality of "The Conjuring"
Review_body: When James Wan came out with "The Conjuring" and then "Insidious" i thought a new sub-genre of horror has been created. That of substance over "cut-screen" scare shots or the Splatterfest, "Gore- or" movies that were so popular in the last few years. WHen i read, James Wan was NOT directing i got admittedly nervous, but John Leonetti not only maintains Wan's level of excellence, imo he surpasses it in many respects. Approaching the tension with a slow build rather than a "haunted house" jump scene, was so effective, that during one of the many "Collective Scream scenes" where the entire theater jump- started, yelled or both, one girl sitting 3 rows in front of me, just got up out of her chair and sprinted out the exit door (not sure what she was running to, but i'm almost positive what she was running from).Anyway, i fully expect there to be reviews from the "too cool", arm chair adrenaline junkies who claim to be "unshakable" in their choice of horror viewing and would probable claim no movie will EVER scare them, but for my $13.00 (not counting popcorn and Twizzlers), this movie delivered on average more scary images per minute than any film i have EVER seen in my entire life!!

Watching horror movies a long time ago used to be something I really enjoyed. I liked getting that tense feeling in my stomach, the tension building, than just when you think it's all quiet, BAM, they get you with some surprise you weren't ready for. Now I watch a horror movie and I all I end up doing is seeing how many times an can guess what's about to happen based on the scene. That is basically what this movie was to me. A very big, and very long guessing game. The whole time I was watching I just kept trying to figure out what would jump out. It's not a bad movie but it was nothing new. I do like the premise of it. As its a prequel to The Conjuring it was very good, but as a horror movie it was not. While I enjoy a little back story now and than, I prefer it to be interesting. I found myself quickly bored of it and ready for it to be over If you are really interested in it, I would go see it. Otherwise pass it up

I am a big horror movies fan and I really had high hopes for this movie because i really loved the conjuring ! BUTthis movie was rubbish ! Not scary , bad , and it only had some jump scares that didn't even work!the music was higher than actions most of the times , the acting was horrible that sometimes i felt they were actually acting !looks like this movie could have been better because the idea isn't bad after all maybe James Wan could have done a better joball in all, it's just a waste of time and i really found it boring. Avoid this.

Watched it with 5.1 surround sound at 2A.M & yet this didn't scare me a sh**. The BGM, which is supposed to be a lethal weapon for a horror movie fails miserably but visual effects were bit convincing though.Moreover, this movie had a senseless plot, despite Mia knew that her previous house was haunted & it was very much because of the doll, yet she takes it to Pasadena so that movie could be dragged on to test our nerves..& also there were no convincing characters to do some justice for this movie.Annabelle scares you...... only if you're compelled to get scared !!

First, I'm glad I didn't watch the trailer... because it's not a trailer, it's a spoiler. They put the best scares on the trailer so it might have ruined my viewing experience, had I watched the trailer first (luckily I didn't).I got mixed feeling about this movie. The good points first then. The atmosphere is creepy, the acting is nice (especially the lady/mom, she's excellent). They build suspense from trivial things (like the sewing machine), and the simple "unknown" factor. The elevator scene is genius!The bad points, in my opinion, is the overused of blasting sound effect that denotes horror/ shock. It's cheap, and unfair. And it happens ALL THE TIME. Some things can't be explained at all... it's just seem like made up things to add to the creepiness but once you think about it, it doesn't make any sense (I'm talking about the drawings here. Come on now, the doll spent some time to draw those prophetic drawings? Where's the logic to that?? And I'm not talking about normal logic, I'm talking WITHIN the movie logic). Also it has really bad moral message in the end that makes something seems to be a good thing where such thing NEVER is a good thing. There are other ways to get rid of that doll, one of the possible solutions was to call a SWAT TEAM or whatever and escort that doll to another country... for example. The ending is the worst part in my opinion.

I really loved Annabelle because I loved the conjuring and I like the way horror movies have been coming up with wonderful ways to scare us lol. I gave this movie a 8 out of 10 because I think that they could've gotten some bigger screen actors or actresses to play in the movie. I did jump like once which is extremely hard to get me to do so I'm happy a scary movie could do that for me. the story line was great I will say I didn't really see anything bad about this movie. I guess I just hoped to see some of the actors from the conjuring lol I know it's a different movie and all. Plus I found out that Annabelle was a raggedy Ann doll not a porcline doll which is even creepier lol

Review title: Didn't blow me away, but a solid movie.
Review_body: Annabelle is one of those horror movies that has the formula that we are all used to. A lot of jump scares. The acting wasn't great, but I did like the story. It had better cinematography that most horror films. There were a lot of shots that were pleasing to the eye. It is not nearly as good as The Conjuring, but its worth watching. The doll is pretty creepy throughout the film. The one thing that killed it for me is that you did not really feel attached to the characters. I think they could have done way better with the casting. In the end, you didn't really care what happened to them. Overall, Annabelle is not as good as The Conjuring. Wait till you can red box this one.

Review title: Outrageous this only has 5.7 rating, brilliant horror.
Review_body: I have recently gone through a phase of watching a few horror movies that I never got around to watching, which includes Insidious 1 and the Conjuring.I am lost for words how anyone can rate Insidious as a brilliant horror movie, I guess it is a sign of the times that putting excruciatingly loud noises when something supposedly scary is on the screen into a film means it is terrifying. That is Insidious all the way through, it is not scary at all, it is a cheap and pathetic trick to scare the audience, you watch those scenes without the sound and they are laughable, Insidious is a joke film yet scores so highly on here because loud noises scare people.I thought the Conjuring was much better than Insidious but still both do not come close to Annabelle. John Leonetti did a better job with this film than James Wan could ever have dreamed of doing.The tension created without the need for outrageously loud bangs sets this film apart from all the tiresome and clichéd films that have come out recently. The sewing machine scenes, the oven scene and the lift scene alone created more tension and horror than any loud noise can create, it was executed perfectly. Even the scenes where nothing happened but you were expecting them to were done perfectly. Sure the film isn't perfect, but as a horror it is beautifully paced and the tension is built up brilliantly. It is easily one of the better horror movies I have seen in the last 5 years. I do not usually watch lots of American horror films because I find them all very similar, similar stories, similar scare tactics so I tend to watch more Korean, Japanese and French horrors but I was pleasantly and massively surprised with how well this movie was done.I would highly recommend this movie to anyone and I put it way above the horror movie comparisons on here such as Insidious and Conjuring, its not even close, this is way better. The fact this film has such a low score really says to me either there is something really dodgy going on with IMDb film ratings or people really do have no taste in real horror movies only the cheesy and ridiculous loud noise/cheap scare ones that are in abundance these days.

Review title: Total joke compared to The Conjuring
Review_body: Basically, all you need to know is that this movie is a way worse version of The Conjuring. I honestly would not waste your time with this one. The scares are unrealistic and the movie has hardly anything to do with 'Annebelle', it actually sort of ruins Annabelle herself, who was actually cool in The Conjuring. The story makes just about no sense at all and is just plain stupid. There are much better movies out there, try The Babadook, Sinister, The Conjuring, Insidious, Ouija, Housebound...hell, just about anything.It seems like they were just trying to ride the train of The Conjuring and had no original ideas of their own.

Like on teen movies there isn't parents around so the dumb plot can happen, here seems to repeat that predictible formula. Two people with no relatives (No parents, brothers, sisters, friends, cousins, nothing) so the characters can't ask for help or anything. Just lazy writing

Annabella I decided to watch this tonight because I watched on live cam them moving the original Annabella from its original case to another case . Not 100% sure why I think it was more of a portable case so they can carry around to take on lectures . and feed naughty kids to . They wore protected gloves and said a prayer then lifted her from its place and placed into the other case then said another prayer. It was a interesting watch but not much to it and only lasted around 8mins, I was expecting a bit more, example a bit of history and background of the doll & story, and maybe a closer look of the doll before putting it into its case ..Now let's be fair we all have some interest in supposedly true stories like these . I say supposedly because I'm referring to ghost \ possession \ haunted etc stories like Amityville horror etc where stories of serial killers we know are true and did happen . Now to me I honestly don't believe the whole Annabella story and there no real proof to back it up except the owners story ...and what they say Now if you don't know anything about the story films like these slightly irritate me because it had no real connection at all about the doll except the film was based on a doll and really used Annabella name to cash in and get a wider and bigger audience. And if you don't know that then you would walk away from the cinema thinking this was the story... After all i had to once explain to someone paranormal activity wasn't true .. But she wouldn't have it because at the end before titles it gave a brief outline of the story as if it was true and because of that she believed it was true otherwise why write that at the end ..face palmThe film itself was half decent and watchable but several element's of the film annoyed me , like for starters scare tactics .. Was there any ? Where the music suddenly BOOMs making you reach for the remote control ready to turn it down..and making you jump in same way as if you walking along street and a friend jumped out from nowhere and loudly shouted boo, NO need that's not scare tactics more of giving you a bloody heart attack tactics, a horror will scare you and keep you edge of your seat on what's happening with atmospheric music in the background. Several scenes reminded me of other horrors like Exorcist and omen where she was pushing the pram with the child in, she had both hands on the pram, then suddenly bent down to pick her keys up that she dropped, while doing so the pram rolled into the road and got hit by a truck.. But that's OK the child was safe because she had hold of it in her arms close to her chest. was this some sort of magic trick to impress pen & teller I like to know if it fooled them in how she did it. Personally if I was to watch a story based on something true like a doll , I would watch a independent film of it than a Hollywood film for several reason, but main reason being is the makers of the indie film would research the story and try to stick as closely as they could to supposedly the real facts, where the Hollywood film would put there own spin on it and exaggerate to suit themselves .

Review title: ANNABELLE IS BEST THAN THE CONJURING I SAID WHAT I SAID
Review_body: As a horror fan i never quite understand what you guys love so much about the conjuring, but anabelle is way superior than the conjuring. The references with rosemary's baby drive me crazy.
This movie was good. Can't remember most of it because it just wasn't memorable. The ending was good and that's it unfortunately. The acting was superb and you did get the whole scared feeling.

Nice and scary
Its first scary film I watched it
I love this film
And the anabel is a the best

Okay first the people who reviewed this movie and gave it high scores must either be production on the film or actors, possibly even kids. Creepy it is not, entertaining it is not. I loved the conjuring and heard this was being released, I thought great I find dolls creepy this will scare me, how wrong could I of been. The doll is lifeless, and about as wooden as the acting. I thought at least we would of got eye movement but no. It stayed slumped on a chair. As for the people saying its creepy, and on a par to Childs plays chucky. Lies its nothing alike. I would say avoid it and go see ouija instead far more creepier. I just hope the conjuring part 2 will be better than this rubbish I was subjected to. A waste of my hard earned cash.

Annabelle was a nice plot device to establish the kind of work the paranormal investigators, the Warrens, did in the before the main plot of The Conjuring started and it probably should have stayed that way. Annabelle is one of those films that are so okay that it's a problem. The film is a prequel/spin-off to 2013's The Conjuring and serves to tell the back story of the possessed doll (Annabelle) that is showing in the beginning of that film. In this film we see that it began as a doll eventually possessed by the spirit of a criminal and that instantly brings Child's Play comparisons to mind but at least Annabelle doesn't use unexplained magical words to make it happen. Throughout the film we see the spirit possessing the doll doesn't do anything physically but manipulates objects in the environment and causes mental delusions. The film decides that it needs more clichés and adds in the fact that everything that has happened is part of some mysterious demon worshiping cult, shadowy monsters to attack in the dark basement, A priest being shown that "The Light of God" is easily overpowered by any demon and a character to make a seemingly random "heroic sacrifice" that in the end serves to accomplish little to nothing. The film isn't anything special and is made up of elements we've seen a thousand times. Overall, I don't feel like there is any real incentive to go see this movie it doesn't add anything to the genre as a whole and doesn't really feel like we are learning anything worth our attention about Annabelle past the first ten minutes. The film is a little less than okay because it just uses tired film ideas and feels like it is playing it too safe because of it.

Review title: Creepy but not frightening, disappointing but average
Review_body: In my personal opinion, I didn't find the movie nearly as atrocious as many others have. I think perhaps it was more disappointing than anything since The Conjuring managed such an effective opening with our star doll. It also set what I consider a high bar for modern horror. I think a story centered on the actual Annabelle would have been more interesting and in tune with Conjuring's 'true story' presentation.I didn't find the dialogue so unbearable as some consider, and while it wasn't a scary film to me, I found it creepy. And I found the inhuman antagonist far more unsettling in design than the one in Insidious.Ultimately, as opposed to tension or fright, what I thought an eerie atmosphere is what kept me following. Of particular note, I enjoyed the sequence in the middle of the film most, when ***SPOILER*** books threaten the child, and Annabelle is lifted by the Demon***END SPOILER***I'm sure many will disagree, but I found this movie perfectly average. Either way, I enjoy it. Everyone has guilty pleasures, but I don't feel entirely guilty with this one. Here's eager waiting for The Conjuring 2!

Review title: A well made and worth watching prequel.
Review_body: Thoroughly enjoyed the film. It entertained and kept me watching. The late sixties setting and Manson occult throwback is a breath of fresh air and helps show the different faces of horror as not all neatly fitting into the hater's box of gore porn. The suspenseful build ups and scares are often nothing new but the film successfully keeps its atmosphere throughout. Though not being blown away, it is a very well made movie and a fine prequel to The Conjuring. Too much of The Conjuring was given away in the trailers. The trailers for Annabelle I ignored intentionally and because of this, a few of the scares jolted me here and there. The film also isn't what many expected or wanted it to be for other reasons, 'Hi, I'm Chucky. Wanna play?'

Review title: Not nearly as bad as I thought it would be!
Review_body: "C'mon! A haunted doll? ...Really??"Obviously, I really wasn't expecting much. But similar to my experience with The Conjuring, I left the theater actually feeling quite satisfied. The doll wasn't as central to the story as one would expect, rather it was more of a symbol of evil in the film. There was some nice character development, an interesting plot, and plenty of moments where I had my mouth wide open because I was terrified! This movie is a lot of fun, and (to my surprise) I would definitely recommend it if you're looking for a movie with fun scares and ACTUAL substance to the storyline (radical concept for a horror film). Bravo! Can't wait to see The Conjuring 2: The Enfield Poltergeist in 2015.

I had high hopes for this movie having liked The Conjuring but I was sadly disappointed. There were only 4 shock scares throughout the whole movie.It seemed to me the doll was not even possessed, just a demon who enjoyed playing with it. I actually noticed more bloopers then scares. I found the characters where just thrown together with no development and outside characters made no sense as to why they were even in the movie since they added nothing. I believe that this movie would have been best served going strait to DVD instead of being offered in movie theaters. For the lack of any attempt to develop the characters or even attempt to make the doll demon possessed(IE moving around on its own, glowing eyes) The one time they actually showed the doll moving by it's self was portrayed as a demon holding it. Overall it was a major disappointment. Definitely not a must see move of 2014.

I really wanted to watch this movie as I have gained interest n horror movies.I also thought the movie would be quaint. But trust me,it is a waste of time and money. Last year's The Conjuring was one of the most thrilling horror movies in ages - this ploddingly predictable prequel is one of the worst. Essentially Rosemary's Baby meets Child's Play for the Paranormal Activity generation, this sees a young Californian couple firstly caught up in a "Helter Skelter" spree by their next door neighbour's cultified estranged daughter and then "menaced" by a demonic doll she may have invoked before her passing. Cue slamming doors, possessed sewing machines and feral hobs as first-time mum Mia (Annabelle Wallis) comes under constant attack in both their Santa Monica starter home and Pasadena apartment. The actors are good but the lack of story line makes it boring.Altogether the movie has ONLY 2 terrifying scenes.And yes-THE DOLL-which only flies once in air. Well..You can skip this movie and watch others like The Conjuring,MAMA,The Cabin in the woods,etc. So from me a 2 out of 10.

I was pretty much sold on this movie when part of the description, mentioned Satanic Cult included. I missed the opening first few minutes, but that was OK, I guess, anyway, my only problem was that I didn't know who theses actors were? But once I got passed that, I sat along for the ride. I really enjoyed the crowd response in the theater, some were screaming with fear at particular scenes. This movie had some elements that were related to Rosemary's Baby, which was kind of a downer because it lacked some originality, but all in all it was a good average experience. You'll be in for a surprise when it comes to seeing the dark shadow revealed, at least I was.

I have been waiting for this film to come out for a while and I was hoping it would be a good horror. It came out today in the UK so me and my boyfriend went to see it in cinemas. We were so disappointed. I am the type that could jump at a door slamming unexpectedly but sadly this film didn't cause me to jump in the slightest, in fact I cannot see how this film can be labelled as a horror. Admittedly the doll was freaky and would scare me if I came across it but the film kept trying to provide cheap thrills.They could have made this film so scary if they wanted to. The storyline slightly reminded me of the film chucky, the only difference is, is that chucky is actually good.

OK... Going into this movie I knew that it was very likely for this movie to be a failure and guess what.... It was. An extremely boring movie that barely made me jump and lost a lot of the creepiness from The Conjuring. The acting is just so plain and bland just like the scares. The movie doesn't even actually explain everything that is going on in a manner that makes sense. There's demons and then a grayish looking creature and a lot of it isn't explained. It's like the director just said put this in there and this... and this. The ending isn't satisfying either. There is no reason to go pay for this movie. Seriously. Don't waste your money. Wait until it comes out on blu-ray or something. The writing was also very odd at times... With Anabelle you're left with a bad taste in your mouth...

I rate it a 9/10 because it had/was a: Great movie. Good plot. Great jump scares and Great acting. Other people writing reviews about this movie are telling you it's not good because it doesn't connect as much as they want it to, to The Conjuring. Sorry, but this movie is called Annabelle, not The Conjuring 2. The people who gave it less than 6/10 probably got so scared that they hated the movie. Overall, this is a great movie leading up to Halloween and I would definitely recommend everyone who loves horror movies to see this soon or on Halloween as it will leave you never wanting to buy a doll for yourself. Also it's well worth your money to see it in theatres.

If you're like me and you enjoyed "Insidious" 1 & 2 and "The Conjuring", then you were probably thrilled at the thought of a movie about Annabelle, that evil doll alluded to in the Conjuring and part of the Warrens' legendary case files. Having read up on the famous demonologists, and knowing the "true" story of Annabelle, I was excited to see the idea continued from that brief tease of them interviewing the hapless nurses at the beginning of "The Conjuring". Well, I was wrong. Instead, I got yet another even briefer tease that launched into one of the lamest most boring horror films since "The Apparition". If the writer(s) had just stuck with the Warren's story, they would have had ample material for a good horror flick. Instead, they cooked up some prequel crap following a boring couple in the 1960s. In many scenes it's as if they forgot the doll was a key component of the movie and would cut the camera over to her face as if to say, "Oh yeah, the doll...she's evil and stuff...right?" The actors seemed like cardboard cut-outs with no dimension or points of interest. It's not all there fault as the script seemed like a first draft from a middle school creative writing class. Even the great Alfre Woodard was wasted, given a cliché role (the spiritualist occult bookstore owner with a past that knows more than meets the eye), and no good dialogue. There was very little conflict save the female protagonists supposed decent into madness which came off like she was just a little agitated and would benefit from a Valium and a nap more than being bogged down by the forces of evil. There was literally nothing scary about this film...nothing! I recall only one uncomfortable moment toward the end involving the couple's baby which was more disturbing and turned out to be a red herring anyway. The rest is pretty tame. The entity which "appears" for a split second in the film (À la Captain Howdy) isn't A fraction as terrifying as the lipstick demon in Insidious. Frankly, Ned Flanders playing the Devil in one of the Simpsons Tree House of Horror segments was scarier. As a viewer, I could tell the filmmakers were going for a "Rosemary's Baby" meets "The Exorcist" vibe, but they failed miserably. Don't waste your time with this, just read the account of the Warrens and Annabelle at night alone and use your imagination. Whatever you come up with will be 100 times better than this steaming turd of a movie.

Review title: At least one wannabe jump scare
Review_body: This is only a small review about "Annabelle", but the movie will never deserve more than that. Overall, this film is about satanic cultists that invaded the home of a family and the upcoming problems with a "cursed" doll. Now you'll maybe think, that this will only be the tip of the iceberg, but no... you could easily sum up everything in another sentence. This movie contains only two sense that fit into the horror genre, all the remaining 90 min you will only sit there in the hope that there will be more than that.... but no there isn't anything. I couldn't even say what the rest of the film is about, beside boring unnecessary talks between the characters.The acting is quiet okay, specially the role of the mother was believable. All the other things like the pacing or close-ups on the doll are more than bad and destroying every horror aspect the movie could build up.I could write more, but I don't want to. I just want to forget this waste of time and move on with Gone Girl. PS: Sorry for my writing skill, its not my native language, but i will try to improve this. Anything beside the fact is your opinion.

Review title: Very very scary , won't let you sleep at night
Review_body: Very very scary . The 2 nd scariest movie of all time right behind the exorcist . I don't get scared easily , I had seen hundreds of horror movies but this one really scared me , the basement elevator scene is the scariest movie scene of all time ( I'm still shaken up by it ) If you want to get scared than go see this movie . Don't listen to people who haven't even seen this movie . Its genuinely scary and I can handle a lot . its about a doll that is possessed and wants to take the main characters child ( her "soul ") , it has some very intense scare scenes , I would say the best scare scenes ever filmed but the doll itself isn't scary at all .

The story follows a man and his pregnant wife (?). The man (don't remember either of their names and I saw it 15 hours ago) gets the girl a hideous looking doll as a gift ,I guess. Later on they are attacked by two lunatics in a Satanic cult. One of the lunatics stabs the pregnant woman in an attempt, we guess, to kill the baby (Keep this in mind). The couple survives, but the doll is now cursed and is determined to haunt the family and take the soul of the baby. The couple moves, and all of the typical ghost-movie things happens. After the first 30 minutes it takes literally an hour before something else noteworthy happens, which seems like longer in a theater. Enter random old black lady. She adds nothing to the story, and her story is completely irrelevant to the main story. In fact, we aren't even told how SHE got involved with the paranormal, or why she would involve herself in the troubles of this family.Another 30 minutes goes by. At this point I'm just ready to get home and watch Sportscenter. The movie ends with the black woman sacrificing herself in order to save the baby and the woman. So thats that I guess. The only purpose the black woman served was to save a white family being haunted by satanic spirits. I'm not offended, really I'm not. But her character wasn't even warranted in the first place, and why would the demonic spirits want her when its invested so much energy taking the soul's of the baby or the woman? And since when does soul taking involve dying? Isn't the point of possessing a soul, possession? Why then was the man in the beginning of the movie trying to kill the baby? lol just stupid.I tried to like this movie, and there are parts that are redeemable. It is not scary however (assuming you are over the age of 6) and there are plot holes littered all throughout the film. The ending was god awful, and I wouldn't doubt if they came up with it on the fly. I swear everything about this movie got worse as it went on, which was far too long. Don't spend 10 dollars, and 2 hours of your life on this movie. Go watch Denzel's new movie, or Space Jam reruns. Both are more compelling and scary.

Review title: Blunt Knife Reviews :Well Knit plot , worth making the trip to the movie halls !!
Review_body: Will make it short and concise, oh wait IMDb needs 10 f*cking lines before i can actually submit it , so i will write the 10 f*cking linesthis is one of the finest Horror movies in a long time , does not over do things, Gripping cinema .The Direction is Sharp , the cinematography is simple,the plot is will knit , the best thing is they are not trying to overachieve and this is what will sell this movie. The current rating on IMDb 6.1 does not do justice to the movie and i am sure bunch of sissies have given that, i am sure this is not 10 on 10 but trust me that this is no less than 8 Horror movies fans are in for a treat , go for it without a doubt , the most honest horror movie in a long time.well done James Wan.Blunt as a Knife reviewsRobbiiee

Review title: Loved it! mixes a few different horror genres together :)
Review_body: I loved The Conjuring when it came out was up there with my favourite movies from last year. Annabelle when first seen the trailers wasn't sure if was going to a good movie on its own. But I was wrong.Don't know how many times I jumped in my seat watching this movie and some of the reactions it was getting from other people in the crowd. It really keeps up the scares and frights and tries to keep them at a good pace throughout the movie. Now this is by no means better than The Conjuring but it is pretty close. The doll is terrifying and I imagine a lot of people won't be looking at their dolls the same again after watching this.

I don't really understand some of the negative reviews, its one of the best horror films that I've seen for a while, some bits will terrify you and leave you frightened even after you have left the cinema. From the moment you see the doll you can tell it is evil and to be feared. However the story and story development are not as good as "The Conjuring" but it contains much more jump scares and scary moments. Unfortunately though you are left with a few unanswered questions after watching. Definitely worth a watch though, even if you haven't seen "The Conjuring" yet but be warned,there were lots of people screaming in the cinema when I watched. 8/10 a great horror film, just in time for Halloween.

Right, when I saw the trailer of Annabelle I reminded myself of how much I enjoyed 'The Conjuring', but when I realised the film wasn't directed by James Wan, I had a bad feeling. I mean, the idea for the prequel had a lot of potential. Knowing where Annabelle came from was pretty interesting and could of been presented much better than it actually was in the film.The start of the film is okay. The scene of murder was pretty good, intense, but then it just got worse and worse. It was slow-paced and just a bit boring (ignoring the fact that someone actually fell asleep in the cinema and started snoring). There was definitely not enough of the 'jumpy moments'. Finally, after we see first few paranormal occurrences, which still were not great the film catches a bit of tempo.Then the film goes on, the main protagonist (Mia) researches about the cult etc, what they always do, the actual demon itself looks creepy so fair play to the directors for that, but overall the film finished rather abruptly.I was expecting a lot more of Annabelle after seeing Conjuring or Insidious, but for me it was just a bit too boring and too 'normal'.6/10.

This film is hilariously bad. I brought it back for me and my girlfriend, and we watched it. This film really tried to pull off the 'omg-look-behind-you' and 'im-really-stupid-so-im-not-going-to-pick-up-that-gun'-type mentatily. I understand this is part of the Horror genre that i so love, but.. this is ridiculous to the point to making fun of you. Because of this, you will probably want to shut it off about 2/3 through, by that stage the shitness couldn't bring me to care about the already weak characters any more anyway, unfortunately. Started so well. What a shame.

I hate scary movies. They do their job and scare me that i can't sleep for days but the trailers for Annebelle made me want to watch the movie. Waited til the movie was on DVD and got it from netflix. I was expecting at least a 2 hour movie when i read it was only 99 minutes i thought it was strange but still was expecting a very scary movie. The movie was slow, boring and not scary at all. Reading about the real doll is scarier then this movie. The only people this movie might scare are children. Not even worth watching on Halloween not even in a dark room all alone. you won't be scared one bit. Best to watch a scary movie made a long time ago when scary movies were actually scary. I watched this with my mother and brother both said this movie was not scary and they watch scary movies a lot.

This is just a painful horror movie to watch. Everything has been done wrong in here and I mean everything. They rip-off stuff from other horror movies like with the popcorn scene (Scream), or they just talk and talk and talk and talk... and it is just so boring that I thought I will fall asleep watching this.There is only one good scene where I god a shiver. At one point is Mia talking to "girl Anabelle" through another room and as the door starts to close the girl runs towards her and enters her room as the dead adult Annabelle. That is the only good scene in here.Othervise - very predictable, really boring, there is no drive or atmosphere or anything.I just hate this movie.

THE TRUE REVIEW "ANABELLE"WOW! "The Conjuring" was a fantastic movie—typical "Modern Horror Film" but with a touch of original SWAGGER. And then there was "Anabelle". Do not get me wrong—the way the film is suspected to be, is exactly how it is. A creepy raggedy doll, a half possessed paranoid wife, and a loving husband. Barbie and Ken go horror. A woman who befriends the wife, and does not find her demonic beliefs too far-fetched. A priest who actually "BELIEVES" the evil is present—and knows the SOURCE. Like it is in a Priest handbook? Scenes where the camera is focused on a window and the curtain blows in the windand you jump up SCREAMING! Of course, I do not underestimate the writers and directors—there is a lot of good horror in this film. My verbal rating? The Conjuring was much better, but it was still not bad.TRUE GENRE: MODERN DAY HORRORIF You're LOOKING FOR: SEAT JUMPING, POPCORN DROPPING, SODA SPITTING, SCREAMING HORROR **This is the film for you**IF You're NOT LOOKING FOR: Cliché, Modern Horror Film, Dolls, Weak Plot **This is not the film for you**A MIX OF: The Conjuring (obv), Paranormal Activity, Exorcist the Beginning, ChuckyDIRECTOR RATING: 6/10 ACTING RATING: 7/10 HORROR RATING: 5/10 OVERALL RATING: 5.5/10

Review title: I really like The Conjuring but this movie made me laugh
Review_body: This is my first review and I'm writing this because I can't believe that people liked this movie. It's awful. And I'm not saying this because they were like only 2 moments in the movie when I feel some kind of fear ( One of the moments was in the trailer so... ) It's just that the characters were boring and everything was so forced.. SPOILER BELOW :I just remember the scene when a demon / ghost appeared behind the doll HAHAHA I laughed at this point in the cinema. So do it yourself a favor and don't watch this movie.

Now some people may remember my review of the conjuring of which i consider one of the bast horror films of all time. Well in 2014 the doll in the film,Annabelle would get a spin off which has revived negative reception from pretty much every one. As it is the film that got me into the genre i will try to provide a non-bias review.The film opens with the opening of the conjuring that being of the Annabelle case and it does it's job it sets the tone of the movie going in. After it we are introduced to our main characters Mia (played by Annabelle Wallis) and john (played by Ward Horton) after a cult breaks into there home they start to experience strange happenings.now i won't spoil the plot anymore but i will say one thing more about this film. It has some actually really terrifying moments one moment takes place in the basement in which Mia is trapped and must get out to save the baby.

Review title: haunted doll is out for blood.
Review_body: Annabelle is one of the most incredible movies I have ever watched. I went to go watch it in theaters with my friends and my family. The only part that made me scream was when the devilish finger popped out at us. I screamed and flung popcorn every where and throw my feet um on my seat. My brother started to cry so he berried his face in the bucket of popcorn. That was the best night ever. I have never watched a movie with so much going on and all had to do with a doll with rosy pink cheeks. After that I had dreams about having a doll like her and it was amazing but frighting at the same time. After I watched the movie I wanted a doll like Annabelle for the longest time ever. My mother told me I was crazy.

Right after watching The Conjuring, I really wanted to see Annabelle. What I got was a boring movie with only a couple of good scares. It doesn't add anything new! Instead of actually showing the doll do scary things, they show demons and ghosts. I wanna see Annabelle! The exposition is interesting but it takes to long. Things started happening 1 hour into the movie! Even then, there's like a 10 minute boring scene after each 3 minute scary scene. The ending scene is the worst though. It doesn't even make any sense!

This movie was not bad at all. The acting, the time period, the wardrobe, the house, and the satanic cult plot was all pretty good. The jump scares and pacing were also nicely done. The black demon scared me the most out of any horror movie I've ever seen. If there's one reason to watch this movie it's the creepy elevator scene. This was a good start to the Annabelle series and I would watch it again.

Starts off ok, some memorable effects, the initial creeps are creepy and the murder scenes are effective. The demon is interestingly done. The weaving in of socal 60s and manson murders and "cults" could have been more thoroughly explored, it was not made into major enough scenery. It's kind of tedious to have every one of these movies have to prove over and over that if you move out of the first house, the demon will follow you to the next house. Can we do something else? How about "stay in the first house", see where that goes?The ending is just inexplicably rushed or anti-climactic, like they were running out of film and had to cut it short. Not entirely convincing or scary, my haunted friend.
The last 10 mins are the only minutes worth watching...
This movie is probably the scariest horror movie that I have ever seen!

Okay folks. This not an Oscar film for sure. It is also not ground breaking by any means. Hell the only thing even remotely true about the film is the first maybe three minutes. This is every horror movie you have ever seen rolled into one. One minute you feel like your watching Rosemary's Baby. Then Rosemary is in the Amityville house. The next moment here comes Chucky with even a little Helter Skelter thrown into the mix. But everything I could say that is wrong with this film is exactly why it works. it embraces its cheese factor. Even revels in it at times. The film has some great scares and in a few cases some real interesting ones. It is just simply a lot of fun to watch with a lot of people. So much so, when Annabelle reveals herself fully you find yourself really into it. I thought the ending was weak but by the time you get to the end it would be very hard to raise the level suspense any higher. There is a scene with a sewing machine and Jiffy Pop which I think should go down in horror movie history for the right way to build suspense. It was funny listening to the audiences nervous giggles as something was about to happen. Go to this as entertainment and nothing more. Nothing deep here. Very little real here. It is based on a true story. However, based is a very loose word here. Three minutes is based upon a true story. Just good October fun.

Review title: This Should Have Been a James Wan Film...
Review_body: Honestly, I don't know why this film wasn't given to Wan (The Conjuring) to film. I don't even know where to begin... How about with the most obvious fact that the movie strayed so far from the original story. If you have to use an overly creepy doll to up the scare factor, then right off the bat you're a sub-par horror movie director. Secondly, the original story takes place in the 70s, not modern day.The movie was a massive cliché. They took a legitimately scary premise in the wake of the high success of The Conjuring and released.... this.I really feel this should have been The Conjuring 2. Or at the very least, it should have been directed by James Wan and starred Patrick Wilson and Vera Farmiga (Ed and Lorraine Warren in The Conjuring).Honestly. Such a massive disappointment. Something that was supposed to be so great ending up so extremely bad...

Got this movie out just to see if it lived up to the hype with the creepy looking doll, strange noises, Satanic cults and the idea of demons hunting for souls . Nope! I think the idea has some premise but a plot that moved at a snail's pace and the lack of truly 'jump out of your skin' scares made it a total bomb. If the characters had realised that their doll was the reason for the bizarre happenings earlier then the film may have been rescued by a supernatural v. human battle with flying objects, invisible pulling hands (a la 'Paranormal Activity) and scary voices that sounded like they were pulled from the depths of hell. While it might be a fright-fest for tweens and teens sadly this adult found herself twiddling her thumbs with boredom.

Review title: Overall disappointing, but with glimmers of promise
Review_body: For a movie that aims to scare you, I left the theatre very much unperturbed. While this is John Leonetti's most competent film, it pails in comparison to its much better prequel "The Conjuring"; the scares and story (save for elements of the ending & a somewhat creepy basement scene) left me wanting. The acting is serviceable, but most of us never really go into horror movies for anything other than the scares. While this is the director's best film, it is in no way a great film; I do however have hopes for Leonetti's future films, coming from a career as a cinematographer his films will be visually pleasing. Unfortunately as of now that's where most of the pros tend to end. But it seems that he may be on the right track, although it may be a long journey

I love a good horror movie, even some of the older cheesy ones, but I actually hated Annabelle. The beginning had potential with the cult thing but then it just turned into the same horror movie that has been released over and over again in the last 5 years. The story lines are always the exact same thing now - an object or person becomes possessed by a demon that wants to take a soul. Then you have the random noises in the house, the opening and closing of doors, the wife who gets tormented and the absent husband who isn't around that much...I could go on and on. Just the same old movie with another name. This was clearly just a money grab based on the fact that The Conjuring did so well - there was very little time or effort put into making this movie scary. Don't waste your money.

Review title: I crushed my cup of coke and spilled my pop-corn at the horror but the story... made me laugh
Review_body: So recently I got a phone call from a friend whom I went to watch The Conjuring with. The last time we hung out was when the movie had released (July, 2013) so, we don't really hangout much. But he called after all these months just because Annabelle was about to release and we were just that excited. That was our first mistake.The horror in Annabelle is just good as compared to The Conjuring which was quite scary. There will be a lot of jerk and scare time and again, people in the back will be mumbling after a good scare during scenes - just normal - no problem with that. The problem although is in the story. Its confusing, at times does not make sense and you would think your nephew could write a better story.Acting: The Conjuring > Annabelle; Direction: The Conjuring > Annabelle; Story: The Conjuring > Annabelle; Horror: The Conjuring = AnnabelleWhy the comparison? Just so you don't carry high hopes to the theater. It hurts. Enjoy the scare.

Review title: Succeeds in scares but fails in it's story
Review_body: I must admit this movie did have my heart racing a couple of times, It had some pretty genuine scares that were well implemented in my opinion. Every scene with that dark demon crept me out (mostly because I watched it with headphones on in a dark room) even to the point were I accidentally knocked my phone to the ground. It was quite refreshing to watch because of it's effectiveness in some of it's scares, yes even the most cheesy ones.However, it was still one of the most cliché modern horror films I have seen, the random door shuts, the loud noises, the house wife and her hard working husband who at some point will work late...case in point Insidious and The conjuring. It did also have a slow start which made me think it wasn't going to be a good film. Despite all it's cheesiness and lack of character development, I still enjoyed watching it. It's a good film, not great but good, and quite scary :)

I am an IMDb junkie who's never written a review, despite having strong opinions about many movies. I am compelled to put in my two cents on Annabelle as the numerical rating seems surprisingly low. My guess is that the critics are the reason for this. It's rare to find a scary movie these days that is actually scary. The movie isn't ground breaking but it is extremely creepy and had everyone in the theater jumping out of their chairs. It was also effective in building suspense and there were a couple of scenes that were so creepy that you could actually feel the terror that the character was feeling. I left the theater feeling like had just live through the experience myself. The cinematography and a surprisingly good performance from the female lead really draws you into the terrifying situation. Personally, I don't care how the movie provided the numerous jolting scenes, the fact is that the entire audience was jumping and screaming the whole time. We were all laughing at ourselves as you know that it's coming, yet you can't help but be jolted. I recommend seeing it in the theater so that you can enjoy the ride with others. It's similar to riding a daunting roller- coaster multiple times, you know what to expect but you still scream every time . It's not The Conjuring but it still works. Annabelle made my heart race in anticipation consistently throughout the movie which is highly unusual in today's horror genre. It's a solid, absorbing 90 minutes of entertainment that doesn't rely on gore tactics. I highly recommend it.

Review title: Bad acting by the lead female, It must be why the low review score
Review_body: The movie actually is entertaining and worth watching. How ever the lead female actor playing Mia almost ruins it. Her acting is not convincing, she shows very little emotion and is not convincing. She seems to mellow like she's on xanax in every scene to me. Everyone else seems like they are more convincing as an actor/character except for her. She isn't "bad" but she wasn't good enough in most scenes.As a director I would have said "CUT" and re-took just about every scene asking for more emotion out of her.It's still worth a watch. I believe from the plot, setting, decor, technology it's supposed to take place in the late 80s. She also feels way to modern as a character and doesn't have the look from that period in my opinion.

Annabelle takes the name of The Conjuring down.. not at all comparable to any horror movie.. horror element in Annabelle is tending to zero and the first half of the movie is like a family movie.. just a time pass if you have nothing to do.. seriously if you have nothing to do.. story contains no strength. Work of actors can be appreciated but the script fails the whole plot. Just a waste of money. It is a boring movie and no one knows why in many countries it has been given adult rating..I personally felt very dissatisfied after seeing this movie.. I was expecting more. The ghosts are not scary.. this movie is a very strange sort of movie..it has been stretched to this length..actually the story is only of ten minutes!...

Review title: The fact that this movie is based on true events adds to the scare factor
Review_body: I thoroughly enjoyed this movie. It provided ample amount of scares causing me to jump out of my skin several times which is very hard for a horror film to bring out of me. The fact that I had watched a documentary about the real doll before watching the movie helped make it that much scarier. If you didn't like this movie it's probably because it scared you a little too much. If you found it slow perhaps you have a form of ADHD (no offense intended). I also loved the fact that they stepped away from the normal format of most movies about demons keeping them invisible and for short brief moments letting us see the terrifying creature.

Review title: A good horror film with some original ideas
Review_body: If you have seen The Conjuring and enjoyed it, then you will most likely enjoy Annabelle. In fact, I preferred Annabelle to The Conjuring because it wasn't overrated, which I felt The Conjuring was. Most of the reviews for this film were negative, so I went into it expecting it to be another clichéd, occasional-jump-scare type film that seems to be just like most modern horror films at the moment. Luckily, it turns out these reviews were wrong, and it turned out to be quite a good horror flick with some effective scare scenes. There aren't any well known actors in it but they actually do a decent job. Annabelle Wallis was the best actor for me, playing the lead role of Mia.There are some really cool original ideas to build the tension in this film, my favourite being the elevator scene, which really made you feel on edge. OK, there are some moments in the film that are a bit slow and sometimes they resort to a cheap jump scare if something hasn't happened in a while, but overall Annabelle delivers exactly what you'd want from a pre-Halloween horror film. Don't watch this film expecting to see a perfect story line and amazing acting, but do expect to see some pretty cool tense scenes and a decent scare now and then.

Review title: Amazing! Scary! Thrilling! Keeps you on the edge of your seat!
Review_body: I loved this movie! I dragged my best friend with me (who is terrified by scary movies) and I jumped more than she did--but thats probably because she kept her head hidden most of the movie. Annabelle is the perfect creepy doll. She doesn't even say anything, yet she's still creepy as hell! It was a slow moving scary movie -- which makes this movie all the more scary. I don't like movies where they throw blood and gore in your face; thats too predictable. This movie had all the pieces of the puzzle to connect both movies (The Conjuring and Annabelle) together. I thought the part where the mother saw a little girl in the nursery, and just as the door was closing the girl came running and flipped to a crazy girl in a bloody nightgown

I personally thought this film was amazing, it was a nonstop thrill ride with a coherent plot and stellar directing. This is the peak of film, it doesn't get much better than this. Acting- perfection Screenplay- perfection Direction- perfect Jump scares WOWZERS I thought silent hill revelations was the best but wow I was proved wrong This movie was f%#£¥g balls don't watch it, this really shows where the horror film industry is going. Down the F@$£#g hillI beg you not to give money to the brain dead slaves who make this s%#£ every year just so they can continue to make the crap at the bottom of the bowl.

Review title: Lousiest horror movie for ALL times
Review_body: After watching this low budget movie i felt i had been ripped off by the dollars I've paid to watch this. Not only is it boring, the protagonist acting is sooo 'wooden' more wooden than the ugly hideous Annabelle doll. There are sooo many loopholes, and i am wondering why the couple just don't burn the doll and dance around the bonfire. There were too many occasions in which Mia failed to look after Leah as one would expect a terrified mother to do. The main character has no expressions of fear and why did she decide to keep the doll after it was found at the bottom of the box in her new place? overall silly and lousy show. Please give me my money back.

I'm a fan and I saw almost all types of horrors which were released until now.It's a pity that I got fulled by the trailer in which it was referenced "The conjuring" movie in which was said that before conjuring was Annabelle.No way there is no way that this movie can be compared with "The conjuring" The actors are bad , the special effects are also bad , the action takes place in an old period , which is not even specified by the scenaristI can say that I saw also a lot of bad movies until now but this is on top I wouldn't recommend it to horror movie fans This is a waste of time I was not able to watch it until end .This is how "great" it is :)

I really loved the Conjuring- the long, slow build up, the intelligent dialogue, and also the believability of the characters' actions. Annabelle, unfortunately , just didn't deliver. I had the biggest problem with the script and acting; the mother (really the major character of the movie) was an unlikeable, whiny, icy blonde who somehow came across as both passive and spoiled, with a pinch of arrogance and entitlement thrown in. Her face was a blank mask no matter what emotion she was supposed to be portraying. I just didn't care what happened to her at all. Not to single her out though- the acting was atrocious across the board, especially the priest who gets called by the couple. The only exception was Alfre Woodard, who played a book shop owner (AND who also very wisely chose not to be listed in the cast credits!!) I really love slowly building , intelligent horror like the Conjuring or the Others- if you do too this move will disappoint.

When a movie like this is rated lower than the Carrie remake, you can be reassured that the people rating horror movies can no longer be taken as a credible source. Undoubtedly, this movie possesses some fundamental issues. With an average script and mediocre acting, Annabelle is by no means the best horror flick, technically speaking (does not measure up to the likes of The Conjuring). Nonetheless, the cinematography and direction are brilliant (very much a Wan-esque style since the director of Annabelle was the cinematographer for James Wan). Additionally, this has an elevator scene that is among the scariest of any of its contemporaries in the genre. The film is truly terrifying, at points. If I could give it a 7.5 out of 10, I would. It continues the recent upward trend in the 2010's revival of the horror genre. Definitely worth the watch! Directing: 4/5 Script: 3/5 Acting: 2/5 Cinematography/Editing: 5/5 Scare Factor: 4/5Overall: 7/10

Predictable(Where you think the scare will come.....It does), Anything remotely scary you already saw it in the trailer(not much else worth jumping about., Pace sucks(If you sit there thinking 'if i leave thats when this movie will turn around and i will miss out.....WRONG., when that urge hits GET THE HELL UP AND ROLL(I could've saved me 30 minutes of continued disappointment., ugh!!!..Doesn't even come close to The Conjurings scares........Im baffled at that 5M dollar budget...Really???., 5M to throw a doll on a shelf and a rocker and film closeups of it DOING ABSOLUTELY NOTHING., And to add insult to injury the audience i sat with were awesomely rowdy and ready from the moment we entered the theatre....What a let down....

Review title: Disappointed in the Acting of the Main Character
Review_body: After watching Conjuring, I felt really excited when I knew that Annabelle will have a movie. I'm a horror fan that's why even if I really don't know much about making a movie but still I trust my own point of view if the horror movie that I'm watching is good or awful. Well, let me talk about the movie first, the effects was really great and very much appreciated the scene where the main character was looking at the little girl in the next room then suddenly run to her and show that creepy woman. It was really great. But the main character, the mother. .I don't know but her acting wasn't good at all! Maybe acting skill like Vera Farmiga and the one who acts as mother in the Insidious 1 and 2 (sorry I forgot the name) would really give justice to the movie. Just imagine, there are times in the movie where i really don't see or feel any frightening emotions on the mother's face - I just don't like her acting that truly ruins the movie (in my own point of view) because in all scenes, she has the scene were "supposedly" take the movie into a more scary one but she always fails to do so.However, the movie was good but I will never want to see that actress again in a horror movie because if she does, i will never have a chance even glimpse at it.

I was so looking forward to this movie, I enjoyed The Conjuring immensely. What a disappointment! Slow moving, predictable, corny. When did horror movies get so bad, there is nothing scary about them these days. All the best bitsof this film are shown in the trailers. Obviously this was just amoney spinner, thrown together to make a quick dollar. Don't be duped into seeing this on the back of how much you enjoyed The Conjuring, it is not a patch on it. Save your money & get a rental copy if you're that intent on seeing it, but don't waste your money on a cinema ticket. The acting itself was not too bad, i've seen worse, hence the 2 score. The directors should be ashamed at producing such rubbish.

Spoiler Alert-ish I'll start by stateing, I'm a huge fan of supernatural/paranormal genre. It was so slow, boring really. It had me yawning, and I wasn't the only one. U could hear others in different parts of theater yawning. LOL This is a made up Hollywood film. The people whom own the doll in movie, don't exist in any way. The real owners were 2 young women. Also the people who investigated (the Warrens) weren't even mentioned in movie. Whats-more, the movie doll is completely wrong from the doll, the real one is a "raggedy-ann" stuffed doll.In 1970 a mother purchased a antique Raggedy Ann Doll from a hobby store. The doll was a present for her daughter Donna on her birthday.For the real story try the warrens website. www.warrens.net

Review title: Good Movie Definitely Worth Watching Before Halloween
Review_body: I'm not the type to write long reviews & give too much unnecessary details. But overall I'm giving this movie a 9 out of 10. I really enjoyed it and would probably watch it again as we get closer to Halloween. The movie had a good story line, and nothing stood out as being too fake or unrealistic. This movie was very well made. I would definitely recommend to watch it this October during the Halloween season. There were definitely plenty of "jumping in your chair" moments and plenty of people screaming in the theater. I think "most" people would enjoy watching it.

I love conjuring movie so went to see screening, stayed 1 hour in line to get in, and was super exited, but this was horrible movie,, almost nothing happen in a movie beside showing how much they love each other, then in the next half,, stupid , stupid scare,, and the end,, cant tell u how stupid it was. Just pure awful. I hated how they ruined the conjuring sequel. This is stupid why it wont let me finish my review here, and want me to type 10 lines, i got nothing else to say about this movie beside its horrible. wow, still wont let me post.. Comeon,, so i am gonna copy paste the last three lines. i got nothing else to say about this movie beside its horrible. wow, still wont let me post..
