Review title: Scary? Sure. A good movie? not so much
Review_body: This movie attracts 15 year old kids who just want to be jump-scared and talk through the whole movie. And it succeeds with that, i would agree that it is a scary movie at some times, but it is far too predictable and sometimes cheesy. As a prequel to The Conjuring I had great expectations and was highly disappointed. And now to spoilers. The "ram" guy was unnecessary and far too similar to the demon in insidious (a great scary movie BTW). It would have been enough with the couples daughter holding and controlling the doll. I understand that they wanted to have the ram there because he is a scary creature and makes for some scary moments and jump-scares in the movie, but sometimes less is more. Overall the movie was well made, but does not compare to The Conjuring in any aspect.

Review title: All I got was failed jump scares.
Review_body: I honestly don't know where to begin. I went into this movie with low expectations that were met, now I figured this movie was likely going to be dodgy in terms of plot and I was correct. The first thing to consider if you plan on seeing this movie is, have you seen The Conjuring? If not, watch it first because there a couple of significant references that you probably won't completely understand without the back knowledge. Personally I think for a 'scary' movie to be considered scary it has to make me think or at the very least stick to my mind after I leave the cinema and Annabelle did neither. One of the many issues I had with this movie was the beginning and end of the movie as there was room for a nice link and the director/writer failed to create an in depth connection between the two. I believe if they had would have boosted the story significantly, I'm not sure if they are planning on making another movie to explain all of the stuff they missed in that sub-story but even if they do this movie was proof enough that it probably wouldn't be worth mine or anyone else's money. My problem with this movie may just be because I'm a stickler for detail, like I love it and that could be why I am so frustrated and annoyed, I mean there was SO MUCH POTENTIAL! I have so many questions that have been left unanswered, like please give me more information (I won't say what kind of information because no spoilers). Side note (before I forget) : It's 2014 why does the 'scariest' part of the movie look like they have had paint dumped on them? (You'll understand me if you watch this film.) Now to reference the summary of this review I need to point out the jump scares. The jump scares were the best part of this movie (even though most of them only appeared when the movie hit its half way point) as they gave me a good laugh as the people around me in the cinema squealed or jumped in fear, personally there was one in particular that the director did a very good job with and it was one of the highlights of the movie for me (maybe it's because little kids are creepy as hell...hint hint). One thing I really enjoyed in this movie was a scene that is within an elevator, this was a great part of the film as it had most of the people within the cinema laughing, me included, so if you decide to watch this movie that is the scene to look out for. In this movie there are multiple scenes that seem significant but really aren't, the was two characters in particular that I thought were for sure going to play a bigger role than what they did but they were shown only once and were never really referenced again, there characters were pair of children that had potential, much like this movie, that was never met. Now if you are just looking for cheap scares then I recommend you watch this but for people who want to be really scared, or enjoy their horror/thriller movies to be summed up nicely with little to no holes in the plot then I would not recommend.

Review title: Horror ? Not in this film. Not even thrills and chills
Review_body: I have watched many many scary movies, some good some bad, none truly scary. Anyone who reviewed this film as scary or awesome obviously has not seen the film. This is a complete snore-fest, from start to finish. I saw perhaps 3 "jump out of seat" scenes where it was totally predictable on it and was yawning each time. The conjuring was a terrific film, and this one is just trying to score big bucks off that name with 1/4 the budget. I was left feeling angry and cheated. There was no depth, no character relation, no story-line, nothing to get you even remotely into the film, except "saw the previews, this is gonna be so good !" feeling you saw when you watched the previews and couldn't wait for this to come out. A complete letdown in all aspects except the fact it actually ended and I could go do something else.

Review title: Some astonishing moments but it's no where near as good as 'The Conjuring'
Review_body: I just watched this movie today and I still can't get over the whole elevator/ staircase demon scene. It was so unique and that alone made this movie so much more enjoyable.There were also some other amazing jump scares that were unfortunately ruined by the trailer. The actors performances however were mixed but I think that was just the script's fault which was the worst part of this film since it was pretty cheesy. But everything else was surprisingly decent. Overall, it's a very fun movie that you can enjoy especially this month (cough...Halloween) but it's not really a masterpiece like 'The Conjuring'.

Review title: ANNABELLE is a total waste of time......
Review_body: I don't think horror is the actual genre for this movie it should be drama,romance,mystery .....conjuring was far more better than annabelle total waste of time... Demons searching for soul and all ain't horror. All the horror part was used in the trailer ..nothing was left for movie....first half was full of drama...nothing interesting Also people say this is the prequel of THE CONJURING I didn't get a connection to that because the doll was shown at the house of the couple at the end of the movie and had no link whatsoever with haunted house ....had high expectations was disappointed .....should have opted foe a sequel that would have been interesting ...something dealing with haunted house or possessed person .......

I really wanted to go see Annabelle after seeing the trailer, which made it seem like a good horror movie... But it wasn't.The movie tells too much in the first couple of minutes and then starts off at a really slow pace. Nothing much happened for the first hour or so. There were a lot of missed opportunities where genuinely scary things could be done. Unfortunately the director choose not to do that, instead he tries build tension and create a mood by having Mia move around really slow... which started to get annoying really fast.There were plot holes, strange reactions from the characters in order to make the story work and so on... In the theater I was watching, there actually were a couple of times the audience spontaneously burst into laughter at how stupid what was happening on the screen was. For me there were two scary scenes in the movie, those who saw the movie probably know the ones I'm talking about. And unfortunately even these scenes could have been made even more scary then they were.This was a story and a movie with a lot of potential, unfortunately it wasn't as good as it could have been.Annabelle isn't a complete waste of time, but if you're looking for a really good, scary horror movie, it's not for you.

Review title: If people didn't like this movie they are kidding themselves.
Review_body: This is certainly one of the spookiest movies I've seen in some time. It had the same jump factor as paranormal activity, and I was on the edge of my seat for the most part of the film! Unlike a lot of horror movies it stayed reasonably believable throughout the entire film and didn't not end with some insane half wit ending. This is not the conjuring, I'm not sure why people are comparing the two? But I think the comparisons are reflecting the poor reviews which would explain the lower scores! They are two different movies that tie in together but I don't feel they should compete but should be in harmony with each other. If you are a fan of horror movies, especially demons or just want to get your heart racing I 100% recommend this movie!

I have to forced 2 of my friends who aren't horror movie fan to accompany me to watch this movie since i thought it would be scary as hell and perfect to open the Halloween month. But it was the biggest waste of 98 minutes of our life. There is no a single scene that surprises us.The plot is made for a kinder-garden kid. It's like reading an open book, no suspense, no mystery.You can easily predict what is about to happen in the next scene. Such a disappointment. The only thing that good about this movie is the marketing team.So if you are looking for a horror movie that will scare you off this is not your option. Don't waste your money on this.

This movie was just, ugh, AWFUL!!!!!!!!! I expected this movie to have the same formula as The Conjuring had. Scare people with suspense not with some cheesy CGI cast off from Insidious. If you took the demon from Insidious, cut off its tail, then you would have the demon in Annabelle. The story is supposed to be about ANNABELLE!!!!!!! not some stupid stereotype American family. The story SHOULD of been about the little girl Annabelle that was in the first 5 MINUTES OF THE MOVIE!!!!! If you watch the first 5 minutes then leave, you have the story of ANNABELLE!!!! If you want to watch the rest of it, be prepared, you barely seen Annabelle do anything. All she does is sit there and do nothing.Everyone scene is predictable, and when you think you will see something, you do, so it takes away all suspense of the film. The Conjuring knew that to scare people you have to make them think they will see something and then DON'T SHOW THEM SOMETHING!!!!!! That is the key, if we anticipate seeing something we will scare ourselves more. Blair Witch Project, Halloween, Jason, Nightmare on Elm Street, The Conjuring all knew this. Scaring people isn't hard to do with a horror movie, but when you feed it to us like were 2 years old, it isn't scary, it is repetitive and boring.A sad example of a sequel. Directors and Producers, you disappoint me. Only cool thing I found in the movie was the fact Mia's real name is Annabelle, which I think was a fun twist to the story haha! Other then that, it was a waste of $10 dollars.

I've been expecting a follow-up to the conjuring since the movie came out last year. To be fair I was kinda feeling funny when they announced the release of a prequel only a year after the first was issued, but still.We all know the downhill of saw movies that keeps repeatedly piling out of the Volkswagen in a call of duty or fifa fashion every year and I thought this prequel would have been sort of a bad movie. Since the conjuring have raised the bar quite high.But holy-cow does it live up, in fact you can say it's a stand alone movie that can easily redeem it's title. The amount of either jump scare and suggested are well balanced making it enjoyable to watch, in a nutshell the ambiance that is settled is disturbing and is supposed to be.Only blind spot the actor play that can be qualified as not as good as the overall execution, briefly said if you're looking for a good scare and potentially the better horror movie of 2014 this is a serious contender.Make your impression as well and go see it, definitely worth it

Review title: Keeping this review short and sweet 7/10 here's why
Review_body: I am going to keep this short and sweet if possible. The movie has some goodscares. First thing I noticed though is it takes a good 30min before anything really happens at all. The director has no problem building his characters lol. It has a Conjuring/Insidious feel to it but definitely not as scary. Go into the mind set that this movie will be good, but nothing more. I did not lose sleep over this like I did with Insidious. Overall good scary moments and a decent plot line with some good acting. Go see it if your into scary movies. If not..... definitely hold out for DVD. My overall score is a 7/10. I would have liked it to have more scares and to not be as slow as it was.

Review title: Do not see this movie (spoiler alert)
Review_body: If you haven't already seen the movie "Annabelle" please do not go! I knew better than to open my mind to such a movie, but for the thrill of a scare I went last night. This movie is extremely sacrilegious. It saddens me to know that millions of people who may not realize it are being deceived. God warns us of false prophets be careful the media has a lot of subliminal messages out there. For instance in the movie...Evil triumphs over good...a priest claims he does not know what to do to help a family (this insults the power of God)...but the problem ends up being solved by a woman who sacrifices her soul to the devil...after doing so the movie starts quoting scripture from the bible to say that this is the ultimate sacrifice and that Jesus demonstrates this by sacrificing his life on the cross....I'm sorry but that is trickery, you do not win by sacrificing your soul to devil...he wins and that's what he wants. and Jesus did not sacrifice his soul to the devil either.. DUH! and yes I probably just spoiled the movie for some out there but to me I could not just sit here and be quiet about this. This is disturbing how scripture was twisted to make people think that losing your soul to the devil is a way to win over evil...I'm sickened. ALSO If you have not paid attention to several movies that have released in the past couple of years, the time is now to start looking into it deeper. Movies such as the hunger games, the purge, the purge 2, Annabelle, the conjuring, and a new one about the Quija board coming out...These movies are the devils way of desensitizing the population to pure evil. It's normal and entertaining now to see murder, demons..just evil. To me hunger games (yes it's a fantastic movie) but it's a clear warning of what is to come...(The chip implanted in their arms, a rich wealthy controlling govt., with people who have nothing, made to fight and to sacrifice innocent lives of children). The Purge, pay ATTENTION...the flowers they put in their yards that they support the purge but do not wish to participate..sound familiar (the passover, blood over the doorways) Also a higher twisted Govt. in behind all of the evil doings, the poor people being killed off first. Not only that this movie subliminally plants the seed that people may not realize...Most of the people in the Purge 2 that suffer are African American, Most of the people purging(killing) are white...This instills racism in people. Fighting amongst races is not what God intends for us. But seeing enough of this subliminally will corrupt the mind whether you want it to or not. And for that reason it is important to know what not to subject yourself to. If people are too caught up on fighting amongst each other and not coming together then we become blinded and miss the bigger picture...and lets face it we can't afford to do that. As far as the conjuring, Annabelle, Ouija...these movies promote exactly what they are about...Summoning spirits, demons etc. It frightens me that this has become entertainment. It's dangerous, it's not fun and games...It is real, God is real, the devil/demons are real. If you entertain it, act upon it, you will get what you are looking for and that just might be the lose of an eternal life that God promises us. I'm sorry this is so long but I had to take a minute to rant a little. People wake up!

Review title: Had the Horror but Dropped the ball
Review_body: Who doesn't get weirded out by the slightly human looking Annabelle? Many people who lay eyes on her are immediately unsettled, and that makes for a perfect horror movie villain. The movie itself was good, it contained great jump scares, areas where the tension was palpable, and as we all know the ever present every creepy Annabelle doll. However, the movie sadly made some key errors that took away from some of the extra potential fear. If you want a decent horror movie to get the adrenaline pumping this might be your cup of tea, but it wasn't as panic inducing as I had hoped. WARNING SPOILERS AHEAD IF YOU HAVE NOT WATCHED STOP READING: The biggest issue with the movie was the fact that the demons face was shown. This should be a no-no for all horror movie makers, and here is why. In this movie it is made abundantly clear that this is the cause of a demon. The movie beats that fact like a dead horse, yet they still insist on showing the audience the demons face. Not a good move. As an 'inhuman spirit' we would assume that it shouldn't look human, and yet they always do. This immediately takes away some of the fear factor from the entity's appearance. I wont lie the movie had it going great with the chase scene where all you can see is the shadowy outline of the demon on the stairs, that was perfect, it kept the audience on the edge of their seats, and it was just far enough into the Uncanny valley' to make your skin crawl. But, alas they showed its face illuminated in a few scenes that followed and that, for me, took away from the fear aspect, because it looked like a human face, not as scary as a supposed 'inhuman spirits face'.Overall the movie was good but not great, if you are scared by jump scares and the classic loud noises in horror movies, then I would recommend that you go and see it. For you steeled veterans while there are some scenes of great misdirection and excellent use of the uncanny valley, it might leave you wanting a little bit more.~O'Halloran

Should have used better effects, the "demon" could have been a lot better, not just a man with costume who looked like the cousin of Insiduous's demon which was pretty lame...Me and my girlfriend were expecting a lot more of this movie...Discovery Channels "A Haunting" is much scarier than this.It was disappointing.It also evolved too slow, and took too long for the conclusion.Also missed the next owners, and the intervention of the Warren's.This could be a second part, I guess most of us expect that it could be much better.Thanks for the attention.Greetings from Colombia, Nicholas.

Review title: Average Horror Movie For Early Halloween
Review_body: Saw It on Golden Theater East Java Indonesia 10/10/2014Annabelle who exactly? At least that's what the author wants to know when watching the movie. It could have missed it, but it did not fit the overall expectations. Annabelle story is nothing more frightening than the main movie The Conjuring Dolls recounted able to write a message or threatening the owner is not significantly visible in the film. If I may guess, figure dolls which quickly attracted public attention it feels it will not appear again in The Conjuring 2 were prepared for broadcast next year.In this spin-off series, this film brings the story of a couple, John (Ward Horton) and Mia (Annabelle Wallis) who is expecting her first child. They live in a house with friendly neighbors.In preparation for the birth of his son, John gave a doll to Mia, which he had sought all along. True, it is the Annabelle doll when it was new had already looks terrible. Surprisingly, Mia like the dolls and put it together with the other doll collection.The situation changed when the neighbor who is also a husband and wife killed their children, Annabelle Higgins told the missing and apparently chose to worship the devil with his boyfriend. Annabelle Higgins and his boyfriend then attacked John and Mia "I like your dolls", the words were spoken after Annabelle injuring Mia . However, police immediately shot dead Annabelle's boyfriend, Annabelle die while suicide and dripping blood into these dolls. ( I Like This Scene Then I Decide To Write It )PROS : - Scary Jumpscare - Storyline Is Simple And Easy To Understand - Basement Scene And When there are small children ghost suddenly turned into an adult, I swear I was surprised really - Sound Effect is Pretty Damn HorrorCONS : - The films is too short I Think , only 98 min - Ending Is Horrible - The Ghost In Not Even Scary ( Except The Black Devil With Horn )

The first half contains absolutely nothing scary other than a short 30 second scene in the first 10 minutes of the film, where the main characters get attacked by the neighbours as part of an attempt to completing some demon ritual.There are a few split second shots of the devil, the ghost of Annabelle Higgins(the spirit trapped in the doll) in the last quarter of the movie. Thats it. Pathetic story. Presentation. Everything. They have cleverly used the name of "The Conjuring" movie to lure audiences into the theatre and try to kill them out of sheer boredom.

Review title: Fear was not missing;but James Wan did..
Review_body: I do remember a scene from The Ninth Gate of Roman Polanski where a man unlocked his elevator as well as library by pressing '6' button 3 times.Which means 666;Or 'Devils Number'.The camera did follow him quietly.However,In Annabelle,if i am not wrong,Mia did the same thing on elevator.I think,the scene requires a little attention to notice about.Especially,it would have better to give a brief idea about "Sigil of Lucifer" or "Lucifer's curse",Which we have noticed on left hand of Mia,done by "Devil"...Although,the works of camera,sounds & make up was quite good.I watched the movie;& i am not disappointed.

sorry seen this and I personally thought it was terrible, the husband is a doctor with no brains, the wife of the doctor again has no brains, you will know what I mean once you have seen the film, and lets be honest if you were up all night pursued by some weird creep you would leave the building, by the way if lifts do have alarms. The film is flawed with a poor story line. Why would the husband leave for a few days when his wife is close to delivering the baby and then the house catches fire and they still return to the house.The priest is really not with it and the lady from the book store decides she needs to get out. Sorry it really is a poor movie. Those of you who say its good really need to be tested or resign from the company who pay you for giving good reviews. No kidding this really is a pants movie seriously don't bother. Don't say I didn't warn you x

It was a very disappointing experience.. I went to the cinema (haven't gone there for a long time) and I was very excited to see Annabelle after seeing The Conjuring. The movie lacks a consistent story or script. The only thing that could scare you are the sounds, nothing more. I like to watch a good scary movie with a nice, or at least plausible or appealing story. The story behind this doll and all that demons' stuff does not make sense even for a terror movie.Fell really short of expectations.. I am still thinking about the time and money spent on this whole movie experience

Review title: okay horror movie, contains the best husband ever
Review_body: As a horror movie, Annebelle is pretty average. It doesn't build up very much atmosphere, and about 90% of the scares are jump scares.As a movie about a struggling family in the mid-20th century, I'd give it a 8 or 9 out of ten. They could have taken the horror elements out of the movie, and made it about a young aspiring doctor trying to navigate his way successfully through the world while taking care of his pregnant wife and soon to be young child while the world is changing into a new a frightening place around them.In other words, as a story about Annabelle, it's decent, but as a saga about John, it could have been one of the greatest stories ever told. He is a young man, fresh out of medical school, struggling to find a residency in 60's/70's California. A time and place of radical transformation for America. Not only does he have this pressure bearing down upon him, of trying to find a secure career while the world around him is changing, but he also has to be mindful of his soon to be baby and wife, who from the outside, probably appears to be going insane.He is a great man, always putting others first, and always committed to his relationships. His wife has a hobby of collecting dolls, and wants a super rare one? Fine, he blows the money he's scrapped together for rent for the next few months on it. Less than a week later she wants it thrown out? Fine, into the trash it goes. She sets the house on fire? Who cares, there has been a baby born, and we never need to go back to that place again. Wife is being attacked by two drugged out cultists armed with knives? Time to go in unarmed and beat them into submission. Wife is generally freaking out, the baby is in danger, everything is going to heck, time to get angry? Yell? Say this is too much, I'm out? No. Let's go to our church for marriage counseling because whatever is wrong can be set right with proper communication and compromise.John is a great, kind, loving man. The kind that I would like to one day emulate. I wish him the best in life, he deserves it.So if you're looking for a movie because you have a couple hours to kill, I'd take it or leave it as a horror movie. If you'd like to admire one of the best men who's ever lived, then I definitely recommend seeing the Saga of John.

Review title: OMFG! please I beg do not waste your time or life watching this!
Review_body: OK, first of all I decided to make an IMDb account just to write a review about how crap this movie was. I cannot believe how poor this movie was it made me so angry and irritated me, the acting was horrible.the characters were just not very convincing I was not scared through this movie, I kept watching it hoping that it's going to get better but it didn't. The conjuring was so much better the acting the plot was so much better. Do not even waste your time watching this movie Annabelle because you will only be disappointed overall I'm giving this movie a 0 out of 10.

Just came back from the cinema AND this is so far the worst horror movie i'v seen i mean it started all good a nice story developed BUT as it was going on it was getting worse and worse it was getting such amateur low budget movie the story got all ruined and all the sound effects were trying to "scare" us but nothing special happened........very disappointed such a good story just done wrong.It is a perfect horror story but it was just so bad that i just wanted to leave the cinema early. i am not recommending this movie.all of you horror junkies will be disappointed after watching this one it's a new 2014 movie but done very very bad.

I just wasted like a hour and half of my life watching this movie. Through the whole movie Annabel doesn't even seem to move at least in the chuckie movies you saw chuckie walking, talking etc. and then what tripped me out is why the hell would the lady mia go down to put something in storage and leave her baby in the apartment upstairs alone knowing that theirs an evil presence all around the house that is after her and the baby. ALSO! the scene were she drops her keys and the stroller goes rolling in the street and once the stroller gets hit she all of a sudden has her baby in her hand.... so many scenes were this movie just did not have any common sense. They could of had a better director do this movie because this movie was a waste of time I'm glad I watched it online through a website that was free rather then going to go spend my money this weekend to watch the film in theaters. this movie was awful and that's just my honest opinion.

DO NOT EVER WATCH IT !!! The worst movie I have ever seen. a waste of time and money and a total bore for anyone of any age. People of the world do not even go close to a cinema while anabelle is on and don't wait for a torrent to downloaded because it is not worth it.Excruciatingly slow moving and predictable with bad acting. There is no plot. Worst story you can imagine for a movie. Did not sympathise with the protagonist. I can not understand who vote for this movie more than one star.Even if you paid me a million bucks i wouldn't watch that movie again. I hope that my comment will save some people from wasting their time and their money for this trash.

Review title: The WORST film I've seen in a while. Just awful.
Review_body: Terrible acting, boring storyline, not even remotely scary.I went with a group of friends to watch and was pessimistic before it even started, as most horror films are terrible anyway... and I wasn't wrong. This film is sooo bad that it's funny at times. Every time they build up suspense you know what's coming - it's so predictable.The lack of a decent story line could have been forgiven had the film been scary, but it wasn't in the slightest. Even the bits that are supposed to make you jump don't because you can see it coming. I was bored to tears and wasted 2 hours of my life that I'll never get back.Don't waste your time folks.

Review title: Oh my god, make it stop, so boring
Review_body: This movie is absolutely atrocious. I say this from the bottom of my heart, this movie will make a true horror movie fan feel nauseous. There are empty and ineffective jump-scares all about. The plot is hollow and pointless. The "horror" factor isn't there, what's so scary about an ugly doll? This abomination of a film is NOTHING like the chucky movies.Don't waste your time. The acting makes me want to cry, Same for the script. The plot is unconvincing and boring. Why was this made? Were the actors involved low on money? It seems like it. I was waiting and waiting for it to get interesting, and every few minutes I keep getting more and more annoyed. Again I say, avoid this movie, it might give you health problems, that's how bad it is.

It isn't as exciting and scary as I expected. It's predictable and there are common special effects. I can rate 7/10, because it has interesting plot. There are playing great actors too. I think the most interesting is older woman from book store. In my opinion, the most boring character is the priest. There is one thing, which I don't understand, why the beginning is so long and boring. Annabelle looks very scary and angry. If I had it, I would burn it or something like this instead of throwing it away. It's classical movie cliché behavior. There are a few scary scenes like this one with a kid who transform into woman. I hope there will be a sequel, because the ending was like "To Be Continued". I hope the sequel will be more scary and there will be more great special effects, characters and better soundtrack and audio effects. I have one more question, where the Warrens are. Why didn't they help this poor family? Why does the priest look clever, but he isn't?

I read the user reviews and I just can't understand how people rate this movie so high. It contains nothing new to the horror genre and it uses almost every cliché there is, like a chair that starts moving or a LP player that starts playing music even though it was tuned off. I'm aware that using clichés can sometimes be a fun and smart way to homage the genre or even other movies but when they do it in this movie it just feels old and unimaginative, we have seen that in soooo many movies before. Sure, i can take that some of these clichés are being used to set a scary tone but when they stack them in every other scene I just get disappointed and annoyed instead of getting thrills. The characters has also been seen in a lot of movies before. Paranormal things happens to a woman, husband don't believe her, paranormal things happens again, husband believe her. It gets so annoying seeing this all the time. A lot of the jump scares were to predictable all though I have to admit that there was a few scenes that got me scared, like when child-Annabelle ran towards Mia and then turned into adult- Annabelle.I'll give this movie 4/10 and that is still being nice.

Review title: Puke thats what i want to do after i watched this movie
Review_body: This is REALLY embarrassing of a horror the storyline is a bloody joke Half of the movie makes kinda sense but when the other half kicks in,ooh the poo is about to begin.The movie is pretending that the audience does not know whats going but is so god damn OBVIOUS,We could had a cool origin of the doll annabelle but NOOOO... we have to see how the couple is dealing with this doll it make me really sad that they had so much to work with but didn't deliver at all.Environment of the movie is always sunny and bright besides the ending and the basement

Well, the biggest pile of poo since an elephant dropped its load in my street. Not a single scare throughout the film, other than being charged £8 by the cinema to sit through the biggest pile of dross I've ever had the misfortune to waste my life on. Don't pay to see this, just, don't. You'll thank me for saving you the money, truly.In fact, the best bit of the cinema experience of this film were the trailers for other, scarier films - it's not good when the 1 minute trailer for another film contains more frights than the whole of the feature.I can only assume that the people who have written 10 star reviews for this are either the cast, or other people who work for the distribution company, because they must have been either paid to review it, or watched a different film.

This was... Not terrible, not good, not remarkable. Annabelle isn't really much of anything, in my opinion. During and after viewing, I was left with the feeling of cliché, cheap scares and no real entertainment. The film's plot is that of an unexceptional horror flick. It's scares, far too few (Almost all of them are showcased in the trailers), feel predictable. Like many others in the same genre lately, I got the impression of the whole picture building suspense on which it does not deliver. Some more positive reviews talk of Annabelle "reveling in it's cheesiness", but I would disagree. It rather uses it as it's very foundation, which just won't do for a horror. So, to summarize: This is a mediocre experience, over-hyped, and not worth paying any money for.

Review title: If you've loved the Conjuring for the right reasons, you will hate this one
Review_body: I had heard this movie was not as good as the Conjuring, but I thought I'd give it a try. Big mistake.This movie is a lazy, badly written horror movie. Irrational behavior throughout the movie - a mother thinks her house is haunted, but leaves her child alone every chance she gets! She even goes shopping and looking for books and have chats outside, with her child nowhere to be seen! People seem to wonder inside the house and first thing she does is leave the room and her child alone. Makes sense...She even gets to the trouble of buying a satanic book (a horror movie cliché) but never, ever, occurs to get rid of the doll. Oh, wait, she did, in the first 20 minutes of the movie. But then decides to have it back again!The actress is very good looking, but fails to deliver - her screams are blatantly faked. Poor editing.Movie is predictable and not scary at all. You will waste your time if you watch this one.

Every body went into theaters to see another Conjuring or at least expecting that level or may be better.But Annabelle i am sorry to say that had the worst assembled cast specially the lead girl with fake expressions. No goose bumps or chills guys just a scene or too.I am disappointed they have mislead the audience and were feeding only on the Conjuring.As a horror genre fan, Annabelle is a disgrace to the genre itself. No story connection, low-budget , awfully long filled with boredom. Script was definitely poor. No fault of the director he did a good job but the actors should have applied for a better institution for training.FYI Conjuring was one of my favourite horror film of all time. Disappointed!! Don't watch it..Waste of time. NBi

It took 49 minutes into the movie to see something really happen that only lasted a second. There is only 99 minutes in the movie 10 of that will be closing credits so really your getting 40 minutes of mediocre movie. 49 minutes of needing tooth picks to keep you eyes open and 10 minutes regretting every minute you wasted watching it. I'm being forced to write 10 lines which will be more entertaining than the actual movie. If its not a innocent baby in danger its the virgin. I really don't like clichés. They haven't even tied together the story. who, what, when, where and how. We learned that in elementary. PS the whole time the doll wasn't doing anything in this movie other than being a doll. STOP THE MADNESS!

Review title: Failed to show movement of doll annabelle ain't no chucky
Review_body: Very bad film, lacked in storyline and only consisted of occasional jump scares with loud high pitched sounds. The Annabelle doll was basically irrelevant as it didn't move or show any potential of life with just camera close up shots of the doll in different positions to state its moved on its own. This film tried to follow the film chucky but failed miserably as the chucky doll is more threatening and the audience know that the doll is a true killer who will have an impact to the storyline. This film should have brought the Annabelle doll to life as it was only scary only down to its personal appearance which lost its impact.

Review title: spoiler's people spoiler's - such potential but never got their
Review_body: the film is badly acted by a cold unemotional wife who never really expresses any real fear or happiness. an example was when she first got the doll took about 2 minutes to acknowledge it or when she is attached before entering into the elevator or when it chases her up the stairs. dis-jointed film where sewing machine gets more attention. i mean whats with the constant sewing. theirs also the fact that she never seems to get thats its evil rather she calls the police i mean seriously.film had such potential but only really gets good towards the end. could have been done sooo much better.

Well, those are 99 minutes I'm never getting back. I was warned about this movie but I didn't listen. The acting was so horrible it was laughable, the plot was cliché and predictable, and the jump scares were really stupid. The movie is called Annabelle, who is a haunted doll that taunted and tortured people, therefore the doll should have more screen time, but she hardly shows up or does anything. Chucky from Child's Play was way scarier, Annabelle is nothing compared to him. This movie was so unoriginal, I had to force myself to keep looking at the screen. It literally made me want to pull an Evelyn and jump out of a building. I have never been more disappointed by a movie, ever. Everyday, I keep losing faith in Hollywood and the movie industry. I think next time I'll listen when someone tells me about a crappy movie. Total waste of time and money.

Review title: Great premise.... Just not that scary.
Review_body: "Annabelle" is the prequel (of sorts) to the 2013 horror hit "The Conjuring". It revolves around John and Mia, a young married couple who are expecting their first child. John purchases the disturbing doll which apparently was missing from Mia's extensive doll collection. Things start to go awry and terrifying events start to happen at the purchase of this doll. Mia and John seek the help of a friendly book-store owner and a priest (two horror clichés in one movie!!!) and the twists and turns ensue. This movie had one great thing going for it its premise. Many fans of "The Conjuring" (myself included) have been looking forward to this since hearing of its announcement and release date. Unfortunately, it did not deliver the scares that its predecessor did. The scares in "Annabelle" were few and predictable as they were shown in the over-played preview. The characters were not developed enough for me to care THAT much for them and the overall plot was generic and forgettable. Going in I though this movie was going to be good or maybe very good but certainly not great. I left thinking it was sub-par to average. I wouldn't say don't see "Annabelle" because the curiosity is definitely there (especially for fans of "The Conjuring"). I will say.. Don't expect much.

The movie started out well. Not outstanding but it caught our attention. Further in the movie it kind of lacked... creativity. The scenes were somewhat cliché. We missed personality even though the story has a history to it. The characters were behaving predictable and there is not much space left over for your imagination. "A few shocking moments doesn't make a good film." Overall a good story if new to the genre but an almost amateuristic production. The casting is one of the few things we liked about it. The actors are giving their characters a personality but sadly those personalities are a bit like any other "paranormal" horror-story.

I watched this movie with my friends. We thought watching a scary movie together would be nice, but this movie wasn't scary what so ever. After 45 minutes there were only about 3 "scary" parts, that were completely predictable...Only the end was interesting, but I am talking about the last ten minutes of the movie... It was really boring and we didn't see most of the movie.If you want to see a real horror movie that is interesting, you should watch "The Conjuring". It is nothing like this movie.-BAR

Review title: How anyone could rate this highly is beyond me.
Review_body: There was such huge potential for this movie to be scary. Extremely creepy looking doll, backstory from The Conjuring , an old house and a baby. But instead of a genuinely haunting movie, we were subjected to an insulting plot with ZERO scares. I am not exaggerating. There were zero scary parts in this. Lots of zooming in on the creepy doll's face. You expect something to happen at this point. The head to move, the mouth to open, the eyes to blink. But no, there was nothing. Just a slow zooming in shot of a stationary inanimate doll.Look at the movie's budget vs. profit and you'll see why the producers wanted to make this movie. It was simply a cash making exercise with no thought given to the plot.This should not be classed as a horror movie. I've seen Scooby Doo cartoons which were scarier than this.
